00035 /**
00036  * MySQL database adapter.
00037  *
00038  * @category   Colony
00039  * @package    Bee
00040  * @copyright  Copyright (c) Army of Bees (www.armyofbees.com)

00043 class Bee_Db_MySQL extends Bee_Db_Abstract
00044 {
00045         /**
00046          * Connects to the defined server and selects the defined database. 
00047          *
00048          * Do not use directly. query() will connect the database if it has not been
00049          * connected already. This method allows the database layer to be instantiated
00050          * on every page without neccessarily requiring a database connection on each 
00051          * page.
00052          *
00053          * @return void
00054          */
00055         public function connect()
00056         {
00057         if( $this->_connection )
00058             return;
00059         
00060                 $this->_connection = @mysql_connect( $this->config['db_host'], 
00061                                                      $this->config['db_user'], 
00062                                                      $this->config['db_pass'] );
00063 
00064                 if ( !$this->_connection )
00065                 {
00066                         throw new Bee_Db_MySQL_Exception( "MySQL Error: " . mysql_error() );
00067                 }
00068 
00069                 if ( !mysql_select_db( $this->config['db_name'], $this->_connection ) )
00070         {
00071                         throw new Bee_Db_MySQL_Exception( "MySQL Error: " . mysql_error() );
00072         }
00073         }
00074 
00075         /**
00076          * Wrapper for mysql_close()
00077          * @return void
00078          */
00079         public function close()
00080         {
00081            mysql_close( $this->_connection );
00082            $this->_connection = null;
00083         }
00084 
00085         /**
00086          * Wrapper for mysql_query(). Expected to be called from _query()
00087          *
00088          * @param string $query_string The query string to run
00089          * @param boolean $no_debug Tells the function if it should record the query in the debug variables.
00090          * @return void
00091          */
00092         protected function _query( $query_string = "", $no_debug = false )
00093         {
00094                 $this->_queryid = @mysql_query( $query_string, $this->_connection );
00095                 
00096                 if( mysql_errno() != 0 )
00097             throw new Bee_Db_MySQL_Exception("Could not compete a query to the database. MySQL error: " . mysql_error() );
00098         }

00100         /**
00101          * Querys the db and gets one row.
00102          * @param string $query_string The query string to run
00103          * @param integer $no_debug Tells the function if it should record the query in the debug variables.
00104          * @return array The 1st row of the query
00105          */
00106         public function queryFetch( $query_string = "", $no_debug = 0 )
00107         {
00108                 $this->query( $query_string, $no_debug );
00109                 
00110                 if( mysql_num_rows( $this->_queryid ) > 0 )
00111                 {
00112                         return $this->fetch_assoc( $this->_queryid );
00113                 }
00114                 else
00115                 {
00116                         return array();
00117                 }
00118         }
00119         
00120         /**
00121          * Querys the db and gets all rows.
00122          * @param string $query_string The query string to run
00123          * @param integer $no_debug Tells the function if it should record the query in the debug variables.
00124          * @return array An array of all rows of the query
00125          */
00126     public function queryFetchAll( $query_string = "", $no_debug = 0 )
00127     {
00128         $this->query( $query_string, $no_debug );
00129         
00130                 if( mysql_num_rows( $this->_queryid ) > 0 )
00131                 {
00132                         $res = array();
00133                         while( $row = $this->fetch_assoc( $this->_queryid ) )
00134                                 $res[] = $row;
00135                         return $res;
00136                 }
00137                 else
00138                 {
00139                         return array();
00140                 }
00141     }

00143     /**
00144      * Grab the unique values from a table for a specific field.
00145      * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00146      * @param string $field The field to pull from
00147      * @return array The unique values that make up the field
00148      */
00149     function queryFetchVar( $query_string, $index = 0, $no_debug = 0 )
00150     {
00151         $this->query( $query_string, $no_debug );
00152         if ( mysql_num_rows( $this->_queryid ) > 0 ) {
00153             $res = $this->fetch_row( $this->_queryid );
00154             if ( is_numeric( $index ) ) {
00155                 if ( array_key_exists( $index, $res ) ) {
00156                     return $res[ $index ];
00157                 }
00158             } else if ( is_array( $index ) ) {
00159                 $ret = array();
00160                 foreach( $index as $r ) {
00161                     if ( array_key_exists( $r, $res ) ) {
00162                         $ret[] = $res[ $r ];
00163                     }
00164                 }
00165                 return $ret;
00166             }
00167         }
00168         return null;
00169     }
00170 
00171     /**
00172      * Querys the db and checsk if one row exists.
00173      * @param string $query_string The query string to run
00174      * @param integer $no_debug Tells the function if it should record the query in the debug variables.
00175      */
00176     public function queryFetchExists( $query_string = "", $no_debug = 0 )
00177     {
00178         $this->query( $query_string, $no_debug );
00179         if( mysql_num_rows( $this->_queryid ) > 0 ) {
00180             return true;
00181         } else {
00182             return false;
00183         }
00184     }

00186         /**
00187          * Inserts an array of data into a table
00188          * @param string $table The table to insert into
00189          * @param array $data The data to insert with keys as field names
00190          * @return resource The ID of the query
00191          */
00192         public function insert( $table = "", $data = array() )
00193         {   
00194                 $columns = '';
00195                 $values = '';
00196                 
00197                 foreach( $data as $key => $value )
00198                 {
00199             $value = $this->escape_string( $value );
00200 
00201                         $columns .= " `$key`,";
00202                         $values  .= " '$value',";
00203                 }
00204                 
00205                 $columns = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $columns );
00206                 $values  = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $values );
00207                 
00208         return $this->query( "INSERT INTO $table( $columns ) VALUES ( $values )" );
00209         }
00210         
00211         /**
00212          * Replaces an array of data in a table or creates a new row
00213          * @param string $table The table to replace info
00214          * @param array $data The data to replace with keys as field names
00215          * @return resource The ID of the query
00216          */
00217         public function replace( $table = "", $data = array() )
00218         {   
00219                 $columns = '';
00220                 $values = '';
00221                 
00222                 foreach( $data as $key => $value )
00223                 {
00224             $value = $this->escape_string( $value );
00225 
00226                         $columns .= " `$key`,";
00227                         $values  .= " '$value',";
00228                 }
00229                 
00230                 $columns = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $columns );
00231                 $values  = preg_replace( '/,$/', '', $values );
00232                 
00233         return $this->query( "REPLACE INTO $table( $columns ) VALUES ( $values )" );
00234         }
00235         
00236         /**
00237          * Updates a row of data in a table
00238          * @param string $table The table to update
00239          * @param array $data The data to update to with keys as field names
00240          * @param string $id_field The field on which to match the row to update
00241          * @param mixed $id The id of that field
00242          * @return resource The ID of the query
00243          */
00244         public function update( $table = "", $data = array(), $id_field, $id )
00245         {   
00246         $setters = '';
00247                 foreach( $data as $key => $value )
00248                 {
00249             $value = $this->escape_string( $value );
00250                         $setters .= " `$key`='$value',";
00251                 }
00252                 
00253                 $setters = preg_replace( '/,$/' , ' ' , $setters );
00254                             
00255                 return $this->query( "UPDATE $table SET " . $setters . "WHERE `$id_field` = '$id'" );
00256         }

00263         public function fetch_array( $queryid = -1 )
00264         {
00265                 if( $queryid == -1 )
00266                         $queryid = $this->_queryid;

00358         /**
00359          * Grab all the data from a table. Makes for easy coding. 
00360          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00361          * @param int $limit The number of rows to limit the results to
00362          * @param int $offset The offset of the row to start from
00363          * @return array The data from the table
00364          */
00365     public function getAll( $table, $limit = 0, $offset = 0 )
00366     {
00367         //--------------------------------
00368         // Check if we're using a limit
00369         // The offset can be 0, since 
00370         // it's equivalent with or without
00371         //--------------------------------
00372         
00373         $sqllimit = '';
00374         if( $limit > 0 )
00375                 {
00376                         $offset = intval( $offset ) < 0 ? 0 : intval( $offset );
00377                         
00378             $sqllimit = "LIMIT $offset, $limit";
00379                 }
00380         
00381         //-----------------------------
00382         // Do some serious data suction
00383         //-----------------------------
00384         
00385         $res = array();
00386         $this->query( "SELECT * FROM $table $sqllimit" );
00387         while( $row = $this->fetch_array() )
00388             $res[] = $row;
00389             
00390         return $res;
00391     }
00392 
00393         /**
00394          * Paginate data from the table.
00395          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00396          * @param int $limit The number of rows per page
00397          * @param int $page The page we're on right now
00398          * @return array The data from the table and the total pages there are
00399          */
00400     public function getByPage( $table, $limit = 0, $page = 0, $where = '' )
00401     {
00402                 $where = empty( $where ) ? '' : "WHERE $where";
00403         
00404                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------
00405                 // I realize these lines may be a bit confusing, so let me explain...
00406                 // Since data starts at 0, you have to subtract 1 from the page 
00407                 // count. But you have to add one when dividing to get the total
00408                 // number of pages. Confusing? Yes, but it works.
00409                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------
00410         
00411                 $count = array_pop( $this->queryFetch( "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM $table $where" ) );
00412         
00413                 return array( 'data'  => $this->getAll( $table." ".$where, $limit, ( $page - 1 ) * $limit ),
00414                                           'count' => $count,
00415                                           'pages' => round( $count / $limit ) + 1 );
00416         }

00419          * Grab an entry from a table.
00420          * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00421          * @param string $id A WHERE condition to match
00422          * @return array The item from the table
00423          */
00424     public function get( $table, $where )
00425     {
00426         return $this->queryFetch( "SELECT * FROM $table WHERE $where" );
00427     }

00435     public function delete( $table, $where )

00440     /**
00441      * Grab the enumeration/set values from a table for a specific field.
00442      * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00443      * @param string $field The field to pull from
00444      * @return array The values that make up the enumeration
00445      */
00446     function enum_values( $table, $field ) {
00447         $row = $this->queryFetch( "SHOW COLUMNS FROM `{$table}` LIKE '{$field}'" );
00448         preg_match_all( "/'(.*?)'/" , $row["Type"], $enum_array );
00449         $enum_fields = $enum_array[1];
00450         return $enum_fields;
00451     }

00453     /**
00454      * Grab the unique values from a table for a specific field.
00455      * @param string $table The name of the table to pull from
00456      * @param string $field The field to pull from
00457      * @return array The unique values that make up the field
00458      */
00459     function unique_values( $table, $field ) {
00460         $res = $this->queryFetchAll( "SELECT DISTINCT {$field} FROM {$table} WHERE {$field} IS NOT NULL ORDER BY {$field}" );
00461         $return = array();
00462         foreach ( $res as $r ) {
00463             $return[] = $r[ $field ];
00464         }
00465         return $return;
00466     }

00468     /**
00469      * Returns the string representation of the processes in mysql
00470      *
00471      * @return string
00472      */
00473     function showprocesslist( $full = false ) {
00474         if ( $full )
00475             $fields = array( "Id", "User", "Host", "Db", "Command", "Time", "State", "Info" );
00476         else
00477             $fields = array( "Id", "Command", "Time", "State", "Info" );
00478         $length = 20;
00479         $borderline = "";
00480         for( $x = 0; $x < count( $fields ); $x++ )
00481             $borderline .= "+-".str_pad( "", $length, "-" )."-";
00482         $borderline .= "+\n";
00483 
00484         $query = $this->queryFetchAll( "SHOW PROCESSLIST;" );
00485 
00486         $output = "";
00487         $output .= "<pre>";
00488         $output .= $borderline;
00489         foreach( $fields as $name )
00490             $output .= "| <b>".str_pad( $name, $length )."</b> ";
00491         $output .= "|\n";
00492         //$output .= "| ".str_pad( "Variable Name", $length1 )." | ".str_pad( "Value ", $length2 )." |\n";
00493         $output .= $borderline;
00494         foreach( $query as $row ) {
00495             foreach( $row as $name => $value ) {
00496                 if ( !in_array( $name, $fields ) ) continue;
00497                 $output .= "| ".str_pad( $value, $length )." ";
00498             }
00499             $output .= "|\n";
00500         }
00501         $output .= $borderline;
00502         $output .= "</pre>";
00503         return $output;
00504     }

00507     /**
00508      * Returns the string representation of the processes in mysql
00509      *
00510      * @return string
00511      */
00512     function showopentables( $full = false ) {
00513         if ( $full )
00514             $fields = array( "Database", "Table", "In_use", "Name_locked" );
00515         else
00516             $fields = array( "Table", "In_use", "Name_locked" );
00517         $length = 20;
00518         $borderline = "";
00519         for( $x = 0; $x < count( $fields ); $x++ )
00520             $borderline .= "+-".str_pad( "", $length, "-" )."-";
00521         $borderline .= "+\n";
00522 
00523         $query = $this->queryFetchAll( "SHOW OPEN TABLES;" );
00524 
00525         $output = "";
00526         $output .= "<pre>";
00527         $output .= $borderline;
00528         foreach( $fields as $name )
00529             $output .= "| <b>".str_pad( $name, $length )."</b> ";
00530         $output .= "|\n";
00531         //$output .= "| ".str_pad( "Variable Name", $length1 )." | ".str_pad( "Value ", $length2 )." |\n";
00532         $output .= $borderline;
00533         foreach( $query as $row ) {
00534             foreach( $row as $name => $value ) {
00535                 if ( !in_array( $name, $fields ) ) continue;
00536                 $output .= "| ".str_pad( $value, $length )." ";
00537             }
00538             $output .= "|\n";
00539         }
00540         $output .= $borderline;
00541         $output .= "</pre>";
00542         return $output;
00543     }

00545     /**
00546      * Returns the string representation of the status of mysql
00547      *
00548      * @return string
00549      */
00550     function showstatus() {
00551         $length1 = 28;
00552         $length2 = 16;
00553         $borderline .= "+-".str_pad( "", $length1, "-" )."-+-".str_pad( "", $length2, "-" )."-+\n";
00554 
00555         $query = $this->queryFetchAll( "SHOW STATUS;" );
00556 
00557         $output = "";
00558         $output .= "<pre>";
00559         $output .= $borderline;
00560         $output .= "| <b>".str_pad( "Variable Name", $length1 )."</b> | <b>".str_pad( "Value ", $length2 )."</b> |\n";
00561         $output .= $borderline;
00562         foreach( $query as $line ) {
00563             $line["Variable_name"] = str_pad( $line["Variable_name"], $length1 );
00564             if ( is_numeric( $line["Value"] ) )
00565                 $line["Value"] = number_format( $line["Value"] );
00566             $line["Value"] = str_pad( $line["Value"], $length2, " " );
00567             $output .= "| ".$line["Variable_name"]." | ".$line["Value"]." |\n";
00568         }
00569         $output .= $borderline;
00570         $output .= "</pre>";
00571         return $output;
00572     }
00573     
00574     /**
00575      * Returns the string representation of the object
00576      *
00577      * @return string
00578      */
00579     public function __toString() {
00580         $out = "<pre>";
00581         $out .= "Database Object\n";
00582         $out .= "{\n";
00583         $out .= "\t[connected] => ".( $this->_connection == null ? "false" : "true" )."\n";
00584         
00585         $out .= "\t[last_query] => ".$this->query."\n";
00586         $out .= "\t[querycount] => ".$this->querycount."\n";
00587         $out .= "\t[querytimes] => ".str_replace( array( "\n", "    " ), array( "", "" ), print_r( $this->querytimes, true ) )."\n";
00588         $out .= "\t[querylist] => ".str_replace( array( "\n", "    " ), array( "", "" ), print_r( $this->querylist, true ) )."\n";
00589 
00590         $out .= "}\n";
00591         $out .= "</pre>";
00592         return $out;
00593     }
